## 판결문 요약








							 




				








IN THE COURT OF CRIMINAL APPEALS


OF TEXAS






NO. PD-1283-09






PABLO PADILLA, Appellant



v.



THE STATE OF TEXAS





ON APPELLANT'S PETITION FOR DISCRETIONARY REVIEW


FROM THE THIRTEENTH COURT OF APPEALS


NUECES COUNTY





	Hervey, J., delivered the opinion of the Court in which Keller, P.J.,  Womack,
Johnson, Keasler, Holcomb, and  Cochran,  JJ., joined.  Price, J. concurred. Meyers, 
J., did not participate.  



O P I N I O N 



	A jury convicted appellant of capital murder (murder during the course of a robbery or an
attempted robbery), and, with the State not having sought the death penalty, appellant received the
mandatory sentence of life in prison without the possibility of parole.  See § 12.31(a)(2), Tex. Penal
Code.  The ground upon which we granted review asks, "Did the Court of Appeals fail to follow
Texas jurisprudence in erroneously affirming Petitioner's conviction because the evidence is legally
and factually insufficient to support a conviction as a principle [sic] or a party to capital murder?" 
See Padilla v. State, No. 13-08-470-CR, slip op. at 7-11 (Tex.App.-Corpus Christi, delivered August
20, 2009) (memorandum opinion not designated for publication) (deciding that the evidence is
legally and factually sufficient to support appellant's capital-murder conviction). We address only
the legal-sufficiency question and decide that...
